intro: Hieracium nobile, commonly known as noble hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and leaves. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Native to Europe, it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
